revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of Cordylophora: A Study of Tubularian Zoophytes
tldr: The author examines the anatomy and physiology of Cordylophora, a type of tubularian zoophyte, focusing on its polypes, conosarct, polypary, and endoderm. They describe the structure of thread-cells, the role of the coenosarc, and the organization of the polypary. The study also discusses the stomach and tentacular canals in the zoophyte, providing insights into its biological functions and classification.
